Great catch. Can you please file a JIRA for this since it has user impact and it would be good to include in the release notes. Also, can you please add a unit test and perhaps assert in a few places that the value is positive?
On second thought, it seems like this has no impact because we use the right value when we deserialize.

@ijuma correct it has no impact - unless you were writing code that did not expect the FetchRequest to be serialized/deserialized, which was my case, so I caught it
happy to merge?

There is at least one test in core `LogCleanerIntegrationTest` that is not annotated. This is because it is `Parameterized`, so uses `RunWith` already. I didn't really feel like re-writing the test

If an application that we launch tries to write to STDOUT, the write could block if we are not reading from this pipe.  That would lead to the application blocking forever.

It looks like what is happening here is that parseExecResult in the subclass is draining the output stream, though.  So let's get rid of this code, since it's not useful.  I will also add a unit test.
retest this please
@ijuma : Thanks for the patch. LGTM.

@ijuma Thanks for clarification! :)

About KAFKA-4893 -- I guess, we should add a check to Streams, but this would be a different PR. The store names checked here are only part of topic names, and thus, we cannot check the topic name length at this level. I created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4912 for this.
